intro: Pedicularis rostratocapitata, commonly known as the beak-headed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often of interest to botanists and conservationists.
